name: Skyline Skydiving Haverfordwest

images.note: Official images available at skylineskydiving.co.uk and Air Adventures Wales social media

description.short: Tandem skydiving in the heart of Pembrokeshire with spectacular coastal views over West Wales from Haverfordwest Airfield.
description.full:
Skyline Skydiving operates from Withybush Airfield near Haverfordwest, offering the only skydiving experience in West Wales and Pembrokeshire. Located in the heart of the stunning Pembrokeshire Coast National Park, this dropzone provides some of the most spectacular coastal scenery for skydivers in the UK.

Operating as Air Adventures Wales (part of The Skydive Centre network), this fully licensed skydive centre offers tandem skydiving experiences at extremely competitive rates. The location gives you breathtaking views over the rugged Pembrokeshire coastline, St Brides Bay, and on clear days you can see across to Ireland and the islands of Skomer, Skokholm, and Grassholm.

The centre specializes in making skydiving accessible and affordable, with tandem jumps from 7,000ft (upgradeable to 10,000ft subject to conditions). Every jump is conducted by experienced, BPA-qualified instructors who prioritize your safety while ensuring you have an unforgettable experience. The airfield operates every weekend (Saturday and Sunday) and Bank Holiday Mondays from March through October.

What makes Haverfordwest unique is its coastal location - you're jumping over one of Britain's most beautiful stretches of coastline. The centre is perfect for combining with a Pembrokeshire weekend break, with stunning beaches, coastal walks, and charming towns all nearby. On-site facilities include a café serving hot and cold food and drinks, making it comfortable for jumpers and spectators alike.

jumpHeights.totalExperience: Approx 4-5 minutes from exit to landing
Approx 5-7 minutes from exit to landing

jumpDetails.aircraft: Typically Islander or similar twin-engine aircraft
jumpDetails.parachuteSystem: Tandem rig certified to British Skydiving standards

accreditations.name: British Skydiving
accreditations.description: Fully licensed and insured skydive centre

features.accommodationNearby: Haverfordwest town centre has hotels, B&Bs, and camping - 10 mins away
features.cafeFacilities: Café on site serving hot and cold food and drinks
features.vrExperience: VR headset option for reliving your jump

requirements.minAgeNote: Under 18s require parental consent and BPA medical form witnessed by parent/guardian
requirements.maxAgeNote: Over 40s require BPA medical form 115A. Over 70s require GP sign-off
requirements.maxWeight: 15 stone for men, 13 stone for women
requirements.weightNote: Strict weight limits - must be proportionate to height. Haverfordwest has lower limits than some centres.
healthRestrictions: Must complete BPA medical declaration form
GP approval required for certain conditions
requirements.whatToWear: Comfortable clothing, trainers or boots, warm layers for altitude

operatingSchedule.days: Saturday, Sunday, and Bank Holiday Mondays
operatingSchedule.note: All jumps weather-dependent. Contact centre if uncertain about weather.

tandem10k.note: Upgrade available on the day subject to conditions - enquire for pricing

videoPackages.note: Various video and photo packages available from £80

charityJump.note: Jump for free when you raise £395+ for charity

views.description: The only coastal skydive in West Wales - jump over the stunning Pembrokeshire coastline with views across to Ireland

Jump over Pembrokeshire Coast National Park

socialMedia.note: Operated by Air Adventures Wales / The Skydive Centre

steps: Book online at skylineskydiving.co.uk or call 020 7424 5522
Meet your tandem instructor and get kitted up
Board the aircraft and enjoy the scenic climb
Exit the plane and experience freefall!
Enjoy the coastal views on your descent
bookingProcess.arrivalTime: Arrive at your booked slot - allow 3-4 hours total
bookingProcess.cancellationPolicy: £50 deposit non-refundable. Free rescheduling up to 4 weeks before. £50 fee within 4 weeks, £100 within 7 days.

faqs.question: Why is Haverfordwest cheaper than other dropzones?
faqs.answer: The standard jump is from 7,000ft rather than 10,000ft+ at other centres, giving you a shorter freefall but still an incredible experience. You can upgrade to 10,000ft on the day if conditions allow.

faqs.question: Can I combine this with a Pembrokeshire holiday?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! This is perfect for adding adventure to a coastal break. Tenby, St Davids, and stunning beaches are all within 30 minutes.

faqs.question: What makes the views special here?
faqs.answer: You're jumping over the Pembrokeshire Coast National Park - one of the UK's most beautiful coastlines. On clear days you can see across to Ireland and the offshore islands.

faqs.question: Is the lower weight limit a problem?
faqs.answer: The 15 stone (men) / 13 stone (women) limit is stricter than some centres, but it's for safety with the specific aircraft and conditions used here. Check before booking if you're close to the limit.

foundedNote: Part of The Skydive Centre network and operated locally as Air Adventures Wales

attractions: Barafundle Bay - one of UK's best beaches
localArea.description: Haverfordwest is the gateway to Pembrokeshire's stunning coastline, charming towns, and outdoor adventures
